item.title: Asymptotic Methods in Analysis
item.description:
Title: Asymptotic Methods in Analysis

Speaker: Fudong Wang

Date: Thursday,

Time: 2:00 pm

Abstract: In this talk, I will introduce the history of several well-known asymptotic methods in analysis. Then we will apply those methods via examples. First example would be apply Laplace’s method to get the one of the oldest asymptotic results, the Stirling’s formula, i.e. $$n!\sim e^{-n}n^n\sqrt{2\pi n},n\rightarrow \infty.$$ Next example is to apply saddle point method to get the asymptotic of the integral $$\int_{\mathbb{R}}f(z)e^{it(z^2+z)}dz,\quad t\rightarrow \infty .$$ Then I will introduce one recently developed asymptotic method called $\bar{\partial}-$steepest descent method, and apply it to study the long-time asymptotic for the linear Schr√∂dinger equation: $$ iu_t+u_{xx}=0,\quad u(x,0)=q(x)\in H^1(\mathbb{R}). $$
